abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the First Agricultural
            Sector Adjustment Credit are to: (i) support the 1986-87
            phase of the Government's program to increase
            production and incomes by making it's agricultural
            economy more market-oriented; (ii) to help prepare the next
            phase of the reform program (1988-90) and (iii) to provide
            foreign exchange for imports needed to realize fully
            benefits associated with the reform program. The price and
            market reform will benefit primarily the farming population,
            whose terms of trade have deteriorated sharply over the last
            decade. Increased production, particularly rice, over the
            next years will benefit urban dwellers. Finally, import
            substitution and higher exports will improve the balance of payments.
